hero.tagline: Foresight and Action for a Connected World
hero.title: Anticipating the World’s Crises
hero.subtitle: — before they collide and cascade.

mission.title: Crises Don’t Stand Alone
paragraphs: Energy shocks fuel conflict. Conflict spreads disease. Health crises destabilize economies. Yet global response remains fragmented.
The Global Nexus Institute (GNI) connects these dots — integrating energy, geopolitics, and health into a unified framework for resilience and equity.
mission.caption: A connected world demands connected intelligence — and collective action.

initiatives.title: Turning Foresight into Collective Impact.
initiatives.subtitle: Two flagship programs translating foresight into measurable change.

projects.title: Global Chokepoints
projects.description: Mapping global chokepoints in energy, trade, and health — using data modeling to predict how disruptions spread and how resilience can be built.

projects.title: Energy Transition Health Index (ETHI)
projects.description: Developing an index that measures how national energy transitions affect public health, equity, and air quality.

leadership.name: Favoud Ahmad
leadership.title: CEO
leadership.bio: Favoud leads GNI with a builder's mindset, integrating industry pragmatism with systems thinking. He drives high-clarity strategy, convenes cross-sector alliances, and turns foresight into execution.

leadership.name: Dr. Saied Froghi
leadership.title: Director of Global Health Policy
leadership.bio: Dr. Froghi brings clinical insight and policy depth to the nexus of public health, crisis response, and equitable system design.

leadership.name: Advisory Council
leadership.title: Strategic Advisor
leadership.bio: We are assembling a council of senior advisors across energy, finance, security, and public health to guide our mission and amplify global impact.

gallery.title: Signals from the Nexus
gallery.subtitle: Hover to reveal the full frame. We expand the viewport — not the image — to show the whole picture.

pageContent.title: Energy Systems
pageContent.subtitle: Understanding global energy transitions and their cascading effects

sections.heading: Overview
sections.content: Energy systems form the backbone of modern civilization. Our research tracks the complex interplay between energy security, geopolitical stability, and public health outcomes.

sections.heading: Key Focus Areas
sections.content: We analyze energy transition pathways, renewable energy deployment, fossil fuel dependencies, and the health implications of energy choices across different regions.

pageContent.title: Geopolitics
pageContent.subtitle: Mapping the intersection of power, resources, and global stability

sections.heading: Strategic Analysis
sections.content: Geopolitical dynamics shape access to resources, health infrastructure, and crisis response capabilities. We provide foresight on emerging hotspots and systemic risks.

sections.heading: Regional Insights
sections.content: Our analysis covers energy corridors, supply chain vulnerabilities, and the geopolitical dimensions of health security and pandemic preparedness.

pageContent.title: Public Health
pageContent.subtitle: Connecting health outcomes to energy and geopolitical factors

sections.heading: Nexus Approach
sections.content: Public health doesn't exist in isolation. Energy transitions affect air quality. Conflicts disrupt healthcare. Economic shocks limit health investments. We connect the dots.

sections.heading: Research Areas
sections.content: Our work spans climate health impacts, pandemic preparedness, health system resilience, and the social determinants shaped by energy and geopolitical forces.

pageContent.title: Resilience
pageContent.subtitle: Building adaptive capacity in an interconnected world for now

sections.heading: Systems Thinking
sections.content: Resilience requires understanding how shocks propagate across energy, political, and health systems. We identify vulnerabilities and design interventions.

sections.heading: Practical Solutions
sections.content: From diversified energy portfolios to robust health infrastructure, we help decision-makers build systems that can withstand and adapt to cascading crises.

siteMetadata.title: Global Nexus Institute — Foresight for a Connected World
siteMetadata.description: GNI connects energy, geopolitics, and health into one field of actionable intelligence.

aboutUs.title: About the Global Nexus Institute
aboutUs.subtitle: Bridging energy, geopolitics, and health for sustainable global stability.
aboutUs.description: GNI is a research institute that bridges the gap between academic insights and practical policy implementation. We focus on the critical intersections of energy security, geopolitical stability, and global health outcomes.
aboutUs.mission: Our mission is to equip leaders and institutions with integrated intelligence to navigate complex global risks.
aboutUs.vision: We envision systems that anticipate shocks, adapt quickly, and promote sustainable well-being for all.
aboutUs.primaryDescription: Energy shocks fuel conflict. Conflict spreads disease. Health crises destabilize economies.
aboutUs.secondaryDescription: Yet global policy and research remain siloed. The Global Nexus Institute (GNI) exists to break those silos — integrating energy, geopolitics, and health into a single field of foresight and action.
aboutUs.missionStatement: We transform complexity into clarity, connecting global challenges into actionable intelligence for leaders who shape our future.
aboutUs.bottomMessage: A connected world demands connected intelligence

principles.title: Integrated Analysis
principles.description: Connecting energy, geopolitics, and health into unified foresight.

principles.title: Systems Thinking
principles.description: Understanding cascading effects across interconnected domains.

principles.title: Actionable Intelligence
principles.description: Translating complex data into strategic guidance for decision-makers.

principles.title: Global Impact
principles.description: Building resilient systems for an interconnected world.

newsTicker.text: GNI launches the Energy Transition Health Index (ETHI) 2025 — a global benchmark connecting energy policy and public health.

partners.title: Partners
partners.subtitle: Building global alliances for systemic change
partners.description: The Global Nexus Institute works with leading organizations across sectors to amplify our impact and create lasting change in how the world approaches interconnected crises.

sections.title: Strategic Partnerships
sections.content: We collaborate with research institutions, policy organizations, and industry leaders who share our vision of integrated analysis across energy, geopolitics, and health domains.

partners.name: Energy Policy Institute
partners.description: Joint research on energy transition pathways and their health implications across emerging markets.

partners.name: Global Health Security Consortium
partners.description: Collaborative frameworks for pandemic preparedness and geopolitical risk assessment.

partners.name: International Crisis Group
partners.description: Intelligence sharing on conflict zones and their impact on energy and health infrastructure.

team.title: Team
team.subtitle: Diverse expertise for complex challenges
team.description: Our team combines deep sector expertise with systems thinking, bringing together professionals from energy, geopolitics, public health, and strategic analysis.

sections.title: Core Team
sections.content: Interdisciplinary professionals who drive our research, analysis, and strategic initiatives.

careers.title: Careers
careers.subtitle: Join the next generation of systems thinkers
careers.description: We're building a team of exceptional analysts, researchers, and strategists who think across domains and thrive in complexity.

sections.title: Current Opportunities
sections.content: We're actively seeking talented individuals who can contribute to our mission of integrated analysis and actionable intelligence.

positions.title: Senior Research Analyst - Energy Systems
positions.description: Lead quantitative analysis of energy transition pathways and their cascading effects on health and geopolitical stability.
requirements: PhD in Energy Economics, Policy, or related field
5+ years experience in energy systems modeling

positions.title: Geopolitical Intelligence Officer
positions.description: Monitor and analyze geopolitical developments affecting global energy and health security.
requirements: MA in International Relations or Political Science
3+ years in intelligence or risk analysis

positions.title: Health Policy Research Fellow
positions.description: 12-month fellowship focusing on the intersection of energy policy and public health outcomes.
requirements: Recent PhD in Public Health, Medicine, or Policy

sections.title: Why GNI?
sections.content: Join a mission-driven organization at the forefront of systems thinking and global impact.

benefits.title: Intellectual Challenge
benefits.description: Work on complex, multidisciplinary problems that matter for global stability and human welfare.

benefits.title: Global Impact
benefits.description: Your research and analysis directly informs policy decisions and strategic planning worldwide.

benefits.title: Collaborative Environment
benefits.description: Work alongside leading experts from diverse fields in a supportive, learning-focused culture.

benefits.title: Professional Growth
benefits.description: Develop unique expertise in nexus thinking and systems analysis with opportunities for leadership.

research.title: Research
research.subtitle: Advancing the science of interconnected systems
research.description: Our research program develops new methodologies for understanding how energy, geopolitical, and health systems interact and influence each other.

sections.title: Core Research Areas
sections.content: We focus on foundational research that advances the field of nexus analysis and systems thinking.

areas.title: Cascading Crisis Modeling
areas.description: Mathematical models that predict how shocks propagate across energy, political, and health systems.

areas.title: Energy-Health Nexus
areas.description: Quantifying the health impacts of different energy transition pathways and policies.

areas.title: Geopolitical Risk Quantification
areas.description: Developing metrics and indices to measure political stability risks to critical infrastructure.

sections.title: Current Projects
sections.content: Active research initiatives that demonstrate our integrated approach to global challenges.

projects.title: Global Chokepoints Initiative
projects.description: Comprehensive mapping and modeling of critical infrastructure vulnerabilities worldwide.

projects.title: Energy Transition Health Index (ETHI)
projects.description: Annual ranking of countries based on the health impacts of their energy transition strategies.

projects.title: Pandemic Preparedness & Energy Security
projects.description: Analysis of how energy system disruptions affect pandemic response capabilities.

sections.title: Research Philosophy
sections.subtitle: → The principles that guide our approach to understanding complex systems

principles.title: Systems-First Thinking
principles.description: We start with the assumption that energy, geopolitical, and health domains are fundamentally interconnected, not separate systems that occasionally interact.

principles.title: Empirical Rigor
principles.description: Every model, every prediction, every insight must be grounded in verifiable data and tested against real-world outcomes to ensure reliability.

principles.title: Practical Relevance
principles.description: Research that can't inform real decisions isn't valuable. We focus on questions that matter to policymakers, business leaders, and crisis responders.

principles.title: Open Innovation
principles.description: The world's challenges are too complex for any single institution. We collaborate openly and share knowledge to accelerate progress across the field.

sections.title: Publications & Collaboration
sections.subtitle: → Our research outputs and opportunities for academic collaboration
sections.description: Interested in collaborative research or data sharing? Let's explore opportunities to advance nexus science together.

outputs.title: Peer-Reviewed Articles
outputs.description: Published in leading journals across energy policy, international relations, and public health domains.

outputs.title: Working Papers
outputs.description: Preliminary findings and methodological innovations shared with the global research community.

outputs.title: Policy Briefs
outputs.description: Research-based recommendations for government officials and international organizations.

outputs.title: Data & Models
outputs.description: Open-source datasets and modeling tools to advance nexus research across institutions.

pageMetadata.title: Research — Global Nexus Institute
pageMetadata.description: Advancing the science of interconnected systems through rigorous research across energy, geopolitics, and health domains.

analysis.title: Analysis
analysis.subtitle: Real-time intelligence for decision makers
analysis.description: Our analysis team provides timely, integrated assessments of emerging crises and their potential cascading effects across energy, geopolitical, and health domains.

sections.title: Analytical Services
sections.content: We deliver actionable intelligence through multiple formats tailored to different decision-making needs.

services.title: Crisis Alerts
services.description: Rapid-response analysis of emerging situations with potential for system-wide impacts.

services.title: Weekly Intelligence Brief
services.description: Comprehensive overview of developing risks across our three core domains.

services.title: Quarterly Outlook
services.description: Deep-dive analysis of major trends and their interconnected implications.

services.title: Custom Analysis
services.description: Bespoke analytical products tailored to specific client needs and decision contexts.

sections.title: Recent Analysis
sections.content: Examples of our integrated approach to current global challenges.

reports.title: Ukraine Crisis: Energy-Health-Security Nexus
reports.summary: Comprehensive analysis of how the conflict affects global energy markets, health systems, and geopolitical stability.

reports.title: Middle East Tensions: Oil Infrastructure Vulnerability
reports.summary: Evaluation of potential disruptions to global oil supply and their cascading health and political effects.

reports.title: Climate COP Outcomes: Policy Integration Gaps
reports.summary: Assessment of how climate policy coordination affects energy transitions and public health outcomes.

advisory.title: Advisory
advisory.subtitle: Strategic guidance for complex decisions
advisory.description: Our advisory services help leaders navigate the interconnected challenges of energy transitions, geopolitical risks, and health crises through integrated analysis and strategic planning.

sections.title: Advisory Services
sections.content: We provide strategic counsel to governments, corporations, and international organizations facing complex nexus challenges.

services.title: Strategic Planning
services.description: Long-term planning that accounts for energy-geopolitical-health interdependencies.

services.title: Risk Assessment
services.description: Comprehensive evaluation of cascading risks across energy, political, and health domains.

services.title: Crisis Response
services.description: Rapid advisory support during emerging crises with multi-domain implications.

services.title: Policy Development
services.description: Support for developing integrated policies that address nexus challenges.

sections.title: Client Sectors
sections.content: We work with diverse organizations that recognize the interconnected nature of global challenges.

clients.description: National security councils, health ministries, and energy departments seeking integrated approaches.
UN agencies, World Bank, and regional bodies addressing cross-cutting global challenges.
Energy companies, healthcare firms, and global enterprises managing systemic risks.
Research institutions and advocacy organizations working on interconnected global issues.
